justification: Participants rated the desirability of each item for eating or giving as a gift on a scale from -50 to 50, which was used to assess the influence of desirability on memory recall.

The dependent variable in the studies was recall likelihood, measured through a free recall task where participants listed items they could remember from a presented list during standard recall versus choice-directed recall conditions.

measured_by: Position of items in presented list
justification: The influence of serial position was analyzed by examining the order in which items were presented in the list and their subsequent recall.

Temporal clustering was measured by computing the conditional recall probability (CRP) of items as a function of temporal association or lag, indicating the probability of recalling an item based on its position relative to other recalled items.
Semantic clustering effects were measured using cosine similarity between word vectors derived from semantic associations to assess clustering based on semantic relationships among recalled items.
